page.title: 06Whiteparish Saddler
page.content: {Mr. J.W.Hyde has worked at these {premises for just 60 years this year. This has however been a saddler's workshop for{over 250 years}to his knowledge. When he started, most of the work was for farm horses, also for people who drove their horses & traps to Salisbury & Romsey markets etc. for shopping. He does not actually make saddles now as he is on his own & has many repairs,new bridles, head collars & other tack to make. It used to take a full week to make 3 saddles, each of which took about 4 sq.feet of leather. The biggest demand now is for riding, showing & driving harness for the show rings. The quantity of work is about the same now as when he started, there are still farm horses and some still drive their traps for pleasure. {GEORGE B.TILL,}still appears above the shop front. (previous owner)
